instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no boot ,no sound but There is backlight
threads.message:
hello,
There is backlight but no apple logo. I tried with a different screen, same result. I removed the ssd and tried it, same thing. no boot ,no corrosion, no sound no boot only backlight is on and charging, 


no corrosion


What can be the problem  ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no boot ,no sound but There is backlight
threads.message:
What is CPU core voltage?
Did you check external video and USB activity?
Did you try known good BIOS?

Any history fault?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no boot ,no sound but There is backlight
threads.message:
L7210/20 <SIGNAL>PPVCCCPU_S0G</SIGNAL> : 1.0 voltage fixed
no display on external display
When I plug in the usb macos, I see that it draws 5volt 0.045A at the usb output. But the options do not appear on the screen.
I felt the heatsink was a little too hot
I haven't tried the bios

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no boot ,no sound but There is backlight
threads.message:
CPU core should drop to 0.6V when boots.
Is time to try BIOS.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no boot ,no sound but There is backlight
threads.message: I tried 2 different bios, same result. I noticed that when the battery is plugged in I read 1.3 volts on the L7210/20 and the heatsink is overheating. I'm reading 0.68 volts with the battery unplugged.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no boot ,no sound but There is backlight
threads.message:
the problem is with the screen
solved
